intro: Copisma viscidulum var. nemorale, commonly known as the sticky copisma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its sticky hairs on the stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. This variant is often found in moist, wooded areas and is adapted to thrive in shaded environments.
